poem:
### Shifts

The dollar rises—  
quick breath of iron tariffs,  
echoed  
in the sound of paper:  
the euro whispers low  
in a wind  
of unexpected worth.  
  
Fragile exchange,  
like brittle leaves  
stirred by  
the unseen hand—  
a dance of currencies,  
this world's  
intangible touch.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "US economy grows faster than expected as Trump announces 25% tariffs on India – business live 2.57pm BST The US dollar has strengthened against the euro, leaving the European currency at a five-week low. The dollar has depreciated markedly during 2025, partly as a result of Donald Trump’s upending of the global trading system making US assets relatively less attractive. However, that trend has reversed in the last week. The euro was down by 0.8%". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: US economy grows faster than expected as Trump announces 25% tariffs on India – business live 2.57pm BST The US dollar has strengthened against the euro, leaving the European currency at a five-week low. The dollar has depreciated markedly during 2025, partly as a result of Donald Trump’s upending of the global trading system making US assets relatively less attractive. However, that trend has reversed in the last week. The euro was down by 0.8%
